image.altText: Ronald Sackville and David Hurley look at the Disability Royal Commission final report

props.synopsis: The disability royal commission's report has been described by advocates as a turning point towards a fully inclusive and de-segregated Australia — but they warn the recommendations must be acted on.

title.children: Disability community says royal commission a turning point, but action must follow

image.altText: a large aboriginal flag flying above a large group of people at a city march

props.synopsis: As Australians prepare to deliver their answer to the referendum question on October 14, there is another question playing out between the two campaigns vying for your vote, writes Dana Morse.

title.children: There's another question at the heart of the Voice debate: Can love ever win in war?

image.altText: A map of east coast Australia showing a large rain system

props.synopsis: This September will go down as the hottest and driest on record in parts of Australia. But after another hot weekend will come a significant drenching, explains ABC meteorologist Tom Saunders.

title.children: Flood and storm threat for southern Australia after record-hot and dry September

image.altText: A three-way composite image shows Jacinda Ardern, Chris Hipkins and Christopher Luxon

props.synopsis: New Zealand Prime Minister Chris Hipkins is fighting for his party's survival as the country heads to the polls on October 14.

title.children: Jacinda Ardern is gone and now NZ will pick between two men named Chris

image.altText: A close up of Sararat Rangsiwuthaporn's standing in front of a sign indicating her height.

props.synopsis: Investigators looking into the poisoning of a woman on a pier unearthed a string of other crimes connected with "Am Cyanide". This is how Thailand's worst suspected serial killer was brought undone.

title.children: A string of bodies featuring black fingernails may have uncovered Thailand's worst serial killer

image.altText: A composite image with the faces of two men, on the left a man with a neo-Nazi badge on his lapel.

props.synopsis: Crispian Chan was eight when his family's Chinese restaurant was firebombed by a neo-Nazi group. As an adult, he set out to track their leader down.

title.children: A neo-Nazi terrorist shaped my childhood. Decades later, I decided to track him down

image.altText: The outside of the Toowoomba Court

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge has ordered that the identity of a high-profile man charged with two counts of rape remain a secret for now.

title.children: Identity of high-profile man accused of rape in Toowoomba to remain secret

image.altText: A Collingwood AFL player looks behind him as he carries the ball, while a Brisbane player pivots to try and close in.

props.synopsis: It's time for the AFL's biggest game of the year, as Collingwood and Brisbane meet in the grand final at the MCG. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: The AFL grand final has finally arrived — here's all you need to know

image.altText: Two men wearing clothes from the early 200s smile and drink champagne.

props.synopsis: Netflix has shuttered its DVD delivery service, triggering co-founder Marc Randolph to revisit the near misses that characterised the company's early days of experimentation and risk-taking.

title.children: Netflix's DVD business almost didn't exist. Twenty-five years on, it has transformed the media industry

image.altText: .A man carries his belongings as he abandons his vehicle in flood.

props.synopsis: A potent rush-hour rainstorm swamps the New York metropolitan area, shutting down parts of the city's subway system, flooding streets and highways.

title.children: New York City under state of emergency after major flash flooding

image.altText: A man wearing a hat.

props.synopsis: One of the last living witnesses to the fatal drive-by shooting of rapper Tupac Shakur is charged with murder, a long-awaited break in a case that has frustrated investigators and fascinated the public ever since the hip-hop icon was gunned down on the Las Vegas Strip 27 years ago.

title.children: Police arrest suspect in 1996 shooting of US rapper Tupac Shakur

image.altText: A young boy is watching TV on the lounge while her mother and baby cuddle together.

props.synopsis: Gaps in high-quality, comprehensive antenatal education are contributing to life-long injuries and birth trauma, maternity experts and parents say.

title.children: 'There's so much I wish I had known': Women speak out about inadequate preparation for giving birth

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Peter John van de Wetering smiling in front of a grey wall

props.synopsis: A man who lured a German backpacker to a remote farm with a fake job advert before drugging, restraining and raping her will remain behind bars.

title.children: 'Severe' risk posed by Peter van de Wetering mitigated with indefinite prison sentence

image.altText: Quincy Timberlake has been charged with murdering his young son, north of Brisbane.

props.synopsis: A former Kenyan presidential candidate who killed his three-year-old son north of Brisbane in 2014, thinking he was possessed by aliens, has been sentenced.

title.children: 'Slapped the devil out of him': Former Kenyan politician sentenced for killing three-year-old son

image.altText: Emergency vehicles and cars on the road

props.synopsis: A crime scene has been established south-west of Brisbane and two people have been arrested.

title.children: Three people hospitalised after Brisbane stabbing

image.altText: Silhouettes of five people are coloured and laid out in a graphic.

props.synopsis: After four-and-a-half years of horrific evidence, Australia's biggest-ever investigation into the treatment of people with disability has dropped its final report. Here are the main takeaways.

title.children: After years of 'harrowing' evidence, the disability royal commission wants these changes

image.altText: A woman pushes Natasha Fyles with one hand and pushes a paper plate into her face with the other hand

props.synopsis: The notices mean Ms Milgate is now banned from entering any NT electoral offices, a breach of which could see her face further legal action.

title.children: Real estate agent Suzi Milgate issued with trespass notices over crepe attack on NT chief minister

image.altText: a woman kneels down in front of a lion enclosure with a lion beside her

props.synopsis: While the sunshine state has jumped on the Brisbane Lions' bandwagon this week, zoo owner Stephanie Robinson has been tending to her own pride. And after work, it's off to the horse paddock to see her broncos.

title.children: Think you're a football fan? Meet a Queenslander with a real-life lion and bronco

image.altText: Injured victims of bomb explosion are treated at a hospital.

props.synopsis: A suicide bombing and another blast have ripped through two mosques in Pakistan, killing at least 57 people and injuring dozens more at events marking the birthday of the Prophet Mohammed, local officials say.

title.children: Twin blasts at Pakistan mosques kill at least 57 people

image.altText: A man in a Harley Davidson shirt with his arm around his daughter, both smiling at each other.

props.synopsis: There was nothing more a father and daughter could do when a car performed a U-turn in front of them as they rode along the Bruce Highway, a court has heard.

title.children: Driver 'tormented' over brief lack of attention that turned birthday ride to crash tragedy

image.altText: A pile of Australian dollar coins on top of several bank notes

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has floated a range of possible changes to the state's Succession Act in a bid to make the laws contemporary and effective for modern society.

title.children: Capping fees, changing definition of spouse proposed for Queensland inheritance law reform

image.altText: A women in a trendy floral dress admires a serene painting

props.synopsis: Over 50 pieces featuring ABC weather presenter Jenny Woodward were entered into this year's ABC Brisbane art competition, with the winning portrait painted by Carol Owens.

title.children: Winner of Jenny Woodward ABC Bradley art competition praises 'beautiful' weather presenter

image.altText: A person washes their hands with water in a white basin.

props.synopsis: Queensland Health investigates a highly infectious disease outbreak in Gladstone, caused by the microscopic cryptosporidium parasite.

title.children: Public warned as cryptosporidiosis outbreak hits regional Queensland city

image.altText: People sunbathing by the beach

props.synopsis: The October long weekend is a welcome break for many Australians – but not everyone gets to enjoy it. Here's who gets a public holiday on Monday.

title.children: Monday is a public holiday, but only for some states and a territory

image.altText: Ellyse Perry wears her magenta and black Sixers kit as she heads a soccer ball

props.synopsis: As a 16-year-old dual international, Ellyse Perry had the choice between cricket and football. As time went on she eventually picked cricket, but after watching the incredible FIFA Women's World Cup, does she have any regrets?

title.children: 'I have no regrets': Ellyse Perry reflects on decision to pick cricket over football

image.altText: An image focuses on a Brisbane NRL player completing a kick for goal, as two Penrith Panthers can be seen at either edge.

props.synopsis: Brisbane may have the ingredients needed to beat Penrith, but denying the Panthers an NRL three-peat in the grand final remains the most daunting of tasks.

title.children: Brisbane Broncos search for answers to deny Penrith Panthers three-peat

image.altText: Black and white image of Whetoi Pomare

props.synopsis: Aotearoa New Zealand has had a treaty in place for almost two centuries but it wasn't until the 1970s that it was truly honoured. So what happened and what are the lessons for Australia ahead of the Voice referendum?

title.children: New Zealand reneged on its Treaty with Māori. Here's its pre-referendum message to Indigenous Australians

image.altText: MG

props.synopsis: Before Harry Potter, the veteran actor made his mark in stage dramas, satirical comedies and crime films.

title.children: Michael Gambon achieved an incredible amount before he put his stamp on Harry Potter

image.altText: An image of book covers overlaid with blue and two robotic hands and arms

props.synopsis: Tech giants have been accused of "mass copyright infringement" and "system theft" by authors whose work has been used to train generative AI systems such as ChatGPT.

title.children: 'Outright theft': Furious Australian authors caught up in literary AI scandal

image.altText: Next to just visible blue pool water, a woman with sunglasses and stripy top lays with phone held over her face.

props.synopsis: If you're trying to change bad habits at work or home, this expert says ignore the traditional approaches to changing behaviour.

title.children: Here's how you create better habits — and it doesn't involve willpower or fad diets
